set.name: Vivienne Westwood Autumn-Winter 2016/17 Collection
set.description:
Vivienne Westwood produced 1639 bags in Kenya as part for its Autumn-Winter 2017 collection.

A total of 33 artisans were involved in producing the order, part of four different community groups: Artisan.Fashion, the Rangau Self-Helf Group, The O's Self Help Group and the Cow Horn Crafts.

52% of the artisans working on the order were women and 88% of the artisans were under the age of 40. 76% of artisans received some form of training to help with the production of the order.

82% of the artisans used income received to fund the education of their children, dependents or their own.

All materials used to produce the order were sourced locally.

Different skills required to produce the order were: Stitching, brass casting, screen-printing, embroidery, horn-carving, supervision, preparation, packing and finishing.

things.name: Oriental Mills to Ethical Fashion Artisans EPZLTD
Sagana Tanneries Ltd
things.description: Local cow hides and goat skins were purchased from Sagan Tanneries Ltd.

things.name: Inkson to Ethical Fashion Artisans EPZLTD
YKK Kenya EPZ Ltd
things.description: Zip components (sliders, zip chain, teeth and tape) were purchased from YKK Kenya to be used for the zip closures of the bags in the Vivienne Westwood Autumn-Winter 2016 order.

things.name: YKK to Ethical Fashion Artisans EPZLTD
The O's Self Help Group
things.description:
The O's Self Help Group is a horn and bone carving workshop. The group offers apprenticeship to school dropouts and youth from poor backgrounds.

There were 2 participants on this project, of which 100% were women.

things.name: The O's Self Help Group to Ethical Fashion Artisans EPZLTD
Sagana Tanneries Ltd to Ethical Fashion Artisans EPZLTD
Thika Cloth Mills Ltd
things.description:
Cotton canvas and cotton kitenge were purchased from Thika Cloth Mills Ltd. Canvas is an extremely durable plain-woven fabric used for making sails and tents in Kenya while kitenge is a softer fabric worn by women, often wrapped around the chest or waist, over the head as a headscarf, or as a baby sling.

Cotton Canvas was used for the construction of the bags while the cotton kitenge was used for the lining of the bags in the Vivienne Westwood Autumn-Winter 2016 order.

For more information see Thika Cloth Mills website: http://thikaclothmills.com

things.name: Thika Clothe Mill Ltd to Ethical Fashion Artisans EPZLTD
Cow horn crafts SHG
things.description:
Kenyan group of horn carvers. These skilled young men started out on the streets, many recovering alcoholics, and have taken control of their life through work. 

There were two artisans from this artisan group working on the Vivienne Westwood Autumn-Winter 2016 order.

ARTISAN TESTIMONIAL

Peter Njagi:

I am a married father of three. I worked as horn crafter on the Vivienne Westwood Autumn-Winter 2016 order crafting zip pullers from cow horns. This year would have been a bad year for us without the Vivienne Westwood order as we haven't been receiving much work. I was so happy to receive the Vivienne Westwood order; even though it was small, I received good money which I used to pay school fees and provide other needs such as food and clothes for my family.

things.name: Oriental Mills
things.address: Oriental Mills Limited, Bishan Plaza, Mpaka Road, Nairobi
things.description: Press studs, webbing and nylon and poly-cotton thread were purchased from Oriental Mills.

things.name: Inkson Industrial Company Ltd

things.description: Water based ink paste was purchased from Inkson Industrial Company. The ink paste was used for screen printing prints on the bags .

things.name: Rangau Self Help Group
things.description:
The Rangau Self-Help Group is a brass workshop run by husband and wife duo, Anton and Benta. The workshop recycles scrap metals to make the brass pieces (locks, engine parts, valves etc). For the Vivienne Westwood order logos were made out of the brass.

ARTISAN TESTIMONIAL

 Richard Ochien’g:

I  am 23 years old, married and a father of two. During the Vivienne Westwood order I received good income enabling me to meet my needs and I learnt a lot of work related skills. I was able to grow professionally while maintaining a good work life balance. I saved a good amount of the income I received, with which I have decided to use to buy materials to start my own brass casting workshop.

things.name: Artisan.Fashion
things.address: Epz, Athi River, Machakos County, Kenya
things.description:
Artisan.Fashion is a social enterprise that was established in 2005 to connect Africa’s artisans to esteemed luxury brands all over the world. 

They are the first African production company to successfully combine artisan creativity and production capability with a careful consideration for traceable social impact. Acting both as a production hub and a disseminator of work, they employ Kenyan artisans in their hub and collaborate with 17 artisan communities across Kenya to produce hand crafted materials and artefacts made with traditional skills.

To find out more visit: http://artisan.fashion

ARTISAN TESTIMONIALS

Martha Mwongeli:

I am a mother of one. I worked on the Vivienne Westwood Autumn-Winter 2016 order as a sewing machine operator. The work was so interesting and it also gave me an opportunity to train and improve my skills. We also received training on how to balance family and work life and counseling on HIV and AIDS. This was very helpful for me, a single mother who intends to get married in future. I used the income to meet most of my needs: rent, meals and clothes.

Pauline Omoloh:

I am 27 and take care of two of my siblings. I worked on the Vivienne Westwood Autumn-Winter 2016 order as a sewing machine operator. In addition to regular income from the order I received good training which has greatly improved my skills. The income from the Vivienne Westwood order enabled me to pay school fees for my sisters and to save money for the future. I also was able to buy a sewing machine which I intend to use to start a tailoring and dressmaking business. 

Nickson Akhwale:

I am 21, and take care of my mother, whom I live with. I worked on the order as preparer in the finishing section. I used the income from the Vivienne Westwood Autumn-Winter 2016 order to pay rent and also increase my savings which I intend to use for college tuition fees for myself.

things.name: Cow horn crafts SHG to Artisans Fashion EPZ Ltd
Artisans Fashion EPZ Ltd to Vivienne Westwood Limited
Vivienne Westwood Limited
things.description: Upon completion, the 1,639 bags for the Autumn-Winter 2016 collection were shipped to Vivienne Westwood in the United Kingdom for them to deliver to their various retail stores and stockists. The bags can also be purchased from their e-commerce store online.
